result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodrigo Rodriguez Mayahua was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rodrigo Rodriguez Mayahua is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rodrigo Rodriguez Mayahua was found guilty of Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rodrigo Rodriguez Mayahua in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Rodrigo Rodriguez Mayahua. James Larson sworn as interpreter. Defendant to plead to Count 1. State recommends $200 plus costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 dismissed State heard. Attorney Sauder herad. Defendant has no comment. Court orders $200 plus costs totaling $705 and DNA.
Status conference on May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

and arraignment. Defendant Rodrigo Rodriguez Mayahua in court.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Sauder in court for Rodrigo Rodriguez Mayahua. Interpreter James Larson sworn and testified. Court reviews charges, penalties, and right to counsel. State requests signature bond. Court orders $1000 signature bond. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to both charges. Court sets status date.
